Sure, here are three types of breathing exercises that you can try:

1. Deep breathing: Sit or lie down in a comfortable position, with your eyes closed. Take a deep breath in through your nose, imagining that the air is filling up your belly first, and then your lungs. Hold the breath for a few seconds, and then exhale slowly through your mouth, letting out all the air. Repeat for a few minutes.

2. Belly breathing: Place one hand on your belly, and the other on your chest. Take a deep breath in through your nose, and imagine that the air is filling up your belly first, pushing your hand out. Exhale slowly through your mouth, letting your belly deflate. Repeat for a few minutes.

3. 4-7-8 breathing: Sit or lie down in a comfortable position, with your eyes closed. Take a deep breath in through your nose, and count to four. Hold the breath for a count of seven. Exhale slowly through your mouth, counting to eight. Repeat for a few minutes.

Remember to start with just a few minutes each day, and gradually increase the duration and frequency of your breathing exercises as you get comfortable. Good luck!
